mapper.select: SELECT country, rownum * 100 power FROM (SELECT 'Germany' country FROM dual UNION SELECT 'United States' country FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Brazil' country FROM dual UNION SELECT 'Canada' country FROM dual UNION SELECT 'France' country FROM dual UNION SELECT 'RU' country FROM dual UNION SELECT 'KR' country FROM dual)

SELECT 'row' || rownum rowname, (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 1.5 + 10) * 1 column1, (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 1.5 + 10) * 2 column2, (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 1.5 + 10) * 3 column3, (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 1.5 + 10) * 4 column4, (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 1.5 + 10) * 5 column5 FROM dual CONNECT BY level < 10
SELECT (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 1.5 + 5) rowname, rownum * 5 column1, -power(rownum - 6, 2) + 55 column2, -power(rownum - 5, 2) + 55 column3, rownum * 15 column4 FROM dual CONNECT BY level < 10
SELECT 'row' || rownum rowname, rownum * 5 column1, -power(rownum - 6, 2) + 55 column2, -power(rownum - 5, 2) + 55 column3, rownum * 15 column4 FROM dual CONNECT BY level < 10
SELECT ename, nvl((select ename from emp where empno = e.mgr), '') mgr, job FROM emp e

SELECT ename, parent, sal, color FROM ( SELECT 'EMP' ename, 'null' parent, 0 sal, 0 color, 0 ord FROM dual UNION SELECT distinct(job) ename, 'EMP' parent, 0 sal, 0 color, 1 ord FROM emp UNION SELECT ename, job parent, sal, sal / 100 color, 2 ord FROM emp ORDER BY ord, parent )
SELECT ename, sal + nvl(comm, 0) sal, to_char(sal + nvl(comm, 0), 'FM$999,999,999') f_sal , nvl2(comm, 'true', 'false') has_comm FROM emp
SELECT ename, hiredate s, (hiredate + (rownum - mod(rownum, 2) * 15 + 100)) e FROM emp
